title: Upper Ceiriog Valley Walk Route

images.title: Eirian Evans / Upper Ceiriog Way
images.caption: The Upper Ceiriog Way, a long distance footpath, crosses the moorland between Llangollen and Llanarmon Dyffryn Ceiriog.

images.title: Jeremy Bolwell / View over part of the Ceiriog Valley
images.caption: View over part of the Ceiriog Valley. Near to Llanarmon Dyffryn Ceiriog, Wrexham/Wrecsam, Great Britain. Taken from a footpath to the south east of the village that climbs up Pen y Glog towards the Upper Ceiriog Way footpath.

images.title: Richard Law / The upper reaches of the Nant Maengwyn
images.caption: The upper reaches of the Nant Maengwyn. This is a tributary of the Afon Ceiriog.

images.title: Part of the Upper Ceiriog by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Summer view of the valley.

description: This is a circular cycling or walking trail through the countryside around Llanarmon Dyffryn Ceiriog near Wrexham . The trail takes you on a tour of the beautiful Ceiriog Valley with views of the River Ceiriog, rolling hill scenery, rushing waterfalls and a visit to the village of Pandy. For cyclists a mountain bike is advised as the trail is quite rugged in sections.
